answerText: Felix Hausdorff[10] For a regular topological space X, this is the compact Hausdorff space beta X such that X is a subset of beta X and every continuous mapping of X into a compact Hausdorff space that keeps X point-wised fixed can be extended continuously to beta X.
heading: ACF Regionals |2012 | Maryland A + Chicago B | 20 | Science | Math | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Answer some questions about a branch of topology, the separation axioms.  For 10 points each: [10] In the separation hierarchy, this man names a type of space in which points can be separated by open sets, sometimes called T-two.  This man also names a type of fractional dimension that can be used to study fractals.
